Package.Root.desc: The root folder of the package, with its package.json

tskb.core.desc: Source code for the core - extraction logic for registry (interfaces) and doc processing <Doc></Doc>

tskb.runtime.desc: Source code for the runtime, the lib does not have an actual runtime, but this folder contains the registry interfaces and jsx runtime primitives

tskb.typescript.desc: Creates a TypeScript compiler Program from source files and tsconfig settings that enables static analysis of code structure, types, and symbols without emitting JavaScript output

core.extraction.desc: Contains the logic for extracting registry and documentation from TypeScript AST

tskb.cli.commands.desc: Command implementations for build, visualize, and query operations

Jsx.runtime.js.desc: The JSX runtime, provided by the package. Includes all available jsx tags in tskb as functions.

sample.tsconfig.json.desc: An example of required tsconfig.json for building <TSKB> docs

typescript.program.desc: Creates TypeScript Program from files and tsconfig for static analysis

runtime.jsx.desc: JSX runtime primitives - Doc, H1-H3, P, List, Li, Snippet components and ref helper

runtime.registry.desc: Registry type definitions - Folder, Module, Export, Term interfaces for global namespace augmentation

extraction.registry.desc: Main registry extraction module that traverses TypeScript AST to extract Folders, Modules, Terms, and Exports from the global tskb namespace

extraction.documentation.desc: Documentation extraction module that parses JSX trees to extract content and references from .tskb.tsx files

cli.index.desc: CLI entry point - handles argument parsing, command routing, and error handling

cli.commands.build.desc: Build command module - orchestrates the complete pipeline from source files to knowledge graph JSON

cli.commands.visualize.desc: Visualize command module - transforms knowledge graph JSON to Graphviz DOT format

cli.commands.query.desc: Query command module - searches knowledge graph and returns structured results with context

library.desc: Refers to the <TSKB> package with all of its capabilities, interfaces and commands

cli.desc: The library exposes a command line interface for main actions - build docs to json graph, gnerate visualization, query a generated graph by keywords

jsxRuntime.desc: TSKB provides a custom JSX runtime (jsx-runtime module) that transforms TSX documentation syntax into a knowledge graph. Configured via tsconfig's jsxImportSource option, it processes JSX elements differently from React - instead of DOM rendering, it extracts documentation structure, references, and code snippets for analysis and visualization.

tsProgram.desc: TypeScript compiler Program from source files and tsconfig settings that enables static analysis of code structure, types, and symbols without emitting JavaScript output.

registry.desc: The global namespace (declare global { namespace tskb }) containing typed interfaces (Folders, Modules, Exports, Terms) that serve as a type-safe vocabulary registry, enabling autocomplete and type-checked references across all .tskb.tsx documentation files.

graph.desc: Refers to th raw output of the library, where it constructs all the relations and connections between folders, modules, exports, terms, docs, etc. In its raw form it is a json file

dotFile.desc: A Graphviz DOT format file that describes the graph structure with nodes and edges, used for rendering visual diagrams of the architecture

queryMatch.desc: A structured result from querying the knowledge graph, containing the matched node, its hierarchy, relationships, related files, documentation context, and AI suggestions for next steps

ast.desc: Abstract Syntax Tree - TypeScript's tree representation of source code, used by the compiler API to analyze code structure

declarationMerging.desc: TypeScript feature that allows multiple declarations with the same name to be merged into a single definition, enabling distributed vocabulary across files

typeChecker.desc: TypeScript compiler component that resolves types, validates code, and provides type information for symbols in the AST

literalType.desc: A TypeScript type that represents a specific literal value (e.g., string literal 'hello' or number literal 42), used to extract constant values from type definitions

jsxElement.desc:
A JSX syntax node in the TypeScript AST representing an element like or

, containing opening tag, children, and closing tag

jsxExpression.desc: A TypeScript AST node representing an embedded expression in JSX curly braces like {ref as tskb.Folders['Auth']}

typeAssertion.desc: TypeScript 'as' syntax that casts a value to a specific type, used in tskb to reference vocabulary items: {ref as tskb.Modules['X']}

depthFirstTraversal.desc: Tree traversal algorithm that explores as far as possible along each branch before backtracking, used to visit all JSX nodes in order

cliPipeline.desc: The six-stage build process: file discovery → program initialization → registry extraction → doc extraction → graph construction → JSON output

commandRouting.desc: The CLI's mechanism for parsing arguments and delegating to the appropriate command handler (build, visualize, or query)

globPattern.desc: File pattern syntax (e.g., '**/*.tskb.tsx') used to match documentation files for processing

Folder.desc: A generic helper to reference folders inside doc files

Module.desc: A generic helper to reference modules inside doc files

Export.desc: A generic helper to reference exports inside doc files

Term.desc: A generic helper to reference terms inside doc files

ref.desc: A placeholder for referencing anything from the global tskb registry into jsx tags

cli.build.desc: The control flow function for building the docs

cli.visualize.desc: Generates a Graphviz DOT file from the knowledge graph JSON

cli.query.desc: Simple demo query command that searches the knowledge graph and returns structured results with context, relationships, and AI suggestions

generateDot.desc: Core function that transforms the knowledge graph into DOT format

ts.createProgram.desc: Creates a TypeScript Program for analyzing code structure, types, and symbols without emitting output

jsx.ref.desc: Reference placeholder for type assertions to registry items

extractRegistry.desc: Main function that extracts the vocabulary (Folders, Modules, Terms, Exports) from TypeScript's type system using the compiler API

ExtractedRegistry.desc: Type definition for the registry data structure containing Maps of folders, modules, terms, and exports

extractDocs.desc: Main function that extracts documentation content and references from TSX files by traversing JSX AST

ExtractedDoc.desc: Type definition for extracted documentation containing file path, content, and all references to vocabulary items

cli.build.ExtractConfig.desc: Configuration interface for the build command containing pattern, output path, and tsconfig path

docs/tskb-package/src/main.tskb.tsx.content:
Architecture and implementation docs for the <TSKB> library The package is located in [Folder: Package.Root]What is <TSKB> ? A TypeScript DSL for type-safe architectural documentation. Generates queryable knowledge
      graphs and diagrams with type-checked references. What it provides in terms of interfaces (API's) and tools In the root folder: [Folder: Package.Root]. In the [Module: package.json]file, it declares a bin command named 'tskb' that runs the [Term: cli]The package exports two main modules, in addition to the [Term: cli]: the index module   [Module: Main.index.js]and the jsxRuntime ( [Term: jsxRuntime]), defined in: [Module: Jsx.runtime.js]Core Primitives for Type-Safe Documentation Main exports (primitives) of the library for creating type-safe architectural documentation: [Export: Folder]: Represents logical groupings in the codebase (features, layers, packages) [Export: Module]: Represents concrete code units (classes, services, components) [Export: Export]: Creates type-safe references to actual code exports using TypeScript's
          typeof import() syntax - ensures documentation stays in sync with codebase [Export: Term]: Represents domain concepts, patterns, or terminology [Export: ref]: A placeholder for referencing anything from the global tskb registry into jsx
          tags with type assertions Plus all the JSX documentation components exported from [Module: Jsx.runtime.js]: Doc, H1, H2, H3,
      P, List, Li, Snippet - providing a familiar TSX syntax for structured content A typical flow of usage Create a docs folder in your repository for documentation files Define a tsconfig.json similar to [Module: sample.tsconfig.json]pointing to repo root with jsx:
        "react-jsx" and jsxImportSource: "tskb" Declare vocabulary (Folders, Modules, Exports, Terms) using global namespace augmentation.
        Use typeof import() for type-safe references. Write *.tskb.tsx files using JSX components. TypeScript validates all references at compile
        time. Run [Export: cli.build]: "tskb \"**/*.tskb.tsx\" --out ./dist/taskflow-graph.json --tsconfig tsconfig.json" The [Term: cli]creates a [Term: tsProgram]and type-checks all documentation files against
        actual source code Extracts vocabulary from the [Term: registry](Folders, Modules, Exports, Terms) Processes *.tskb.tsx files, extracting content and references Constructs the [Term: graph]by analyzing relationships and hierarchies Outputs JSON knowledge graph optimized for AI agents and tooling Generating a visual representation: Run [Export: cli.visualize]: "tskb visualize ./dist/taskflow-graph.json --out
        ./dist/architecture.dot" [Export: generateDot]transforms the [Term: graph]into a [Term: dotFile]with nodes and
        relationship edges Render with Graphviz: "dot -Tpng architecture.dot -o architecture.png" Or use interactive viewers like xdot or online Graphviz tools Key Benefits Type-checked references: Renames, moves, or API changes break the build - enforcing
        correctness Validated snippets: Code examples are type-checked against actual source Living documentation: Stays in sync through the compiler - CI catches drift AI-optimized: Queryable knowledge graph reduces hallucination Docs as infrastructure: Compile-time validation, not afterthought Querying the knowledge graph Demo query command for programmatic [Term: graph]access by AI agents and tools Run [Export: cli.query]: "tskb query ./dist/taskflow-graph.json auth" Searches all node types matching against IDs, descriptions, paths, and content Each [Term: queryMatch]includes: node with relevance score, hierarchy breadcrumb, parent
        context, related files, relationships, and AI suggestions Sorted by relevance: ID matches highest, then path, description, and content Outputs structured JSON for AI consumption and tooling Documentation Philosophy: Map, Not Manual Write structural signposts showing what exists where and how pieces connect - not
      implementation details. Document structure: Declare folders, locations, and key relationships Use type-safe references: typeof import() ensures TypeScript validates existence and catches
        renames Focus on WHAT and WHERE, not HOW: Describe purpose and location, not algorithms Trust validation: TSKB catches broken references, not behavior changes Major relationships only: Document architectural connections, not every dependency

docs/tskb-package/src/typescript/typescr.content:
TypeScript Program Located in [Folder: tskb.typescript]. Creates [Term: tsProgram]for analyzing code without compilation. Key Module [Module: typescript.program]: Exports [Export: ts.createProgram]which: Reads and parses tsconfig.json for compiler options Creates TypeScript Program with noEmit=true (analysis only) Validates TypeScript errors in specified files Returns Program with AST, type checker, and symbol resolution Purpose Provides the [Term: tsProgram]used by extraction logic to parse *.tskb.tsx files, resolve
      types, and walk ASTs for registry and documentation extraction.

docs/tskb-package/src/runtime/runtime.ts.content:
Runtime Located in [Folder: tskb.runtime]. Contains registry type definitions and JSX primitives - no actual
      runtime execution. Modules [Module: runtime.jsx]: JSX runtime with [Export: jsx.Doc]and heading/paragraph/list components. Includes   [Export: jsx.ref]for type-safe registry references. [Module: runtime.registry]: Type definitions for Folder, Module, Export, Term interfaces used in
        global namespace augmentation. Purpose Provides TypeScript types and JSX functions for authoring *.tskb.tsx files. Registry
      interfaces enable type-safe vocabulary declarations. JSX components structure documentation
      content.

docs/tskb-package/src/cli/cli-overview.t.content: CLI Implementation Entry: [Module: cli.index]- Command routing, arg parsing, error handling. Commands:   [Folder: tskb.cli.commands]Entry Point [Module: cli.index]- [Term: commandRouting]Parses process.argv → command + args Validates required args, provides defaults (--out, --tsconfig) Backward compat: allows pattern without "build" prefix Routes to command handlers with typed configs Build Command [Module: cli.commands.build]( [Export: cli.build]) - [Term: cliPipeline]File Discovery: [Term: globPattern]→ .tskb.tsx files Program Init: Create [Term: tsProgram]Registry: Extract [Term: registry]from global namespace Docs: Parse JSX trees → content + refs Graph: Build [Term: graph]nodes + edges Output: Write JSON Visualize Command [Module: cli.commands.visualize]( [Export: cli.visualize]) Read [Term: graph]JSON Call [Export: generateDot]→ [Term: dotFile]Write DOT file Query Command [Module: cli.commands.query]( [Export: cli.query]) Load graph JSON Search: node IDs, paths, descs, content Score: ID=10, path=8, desc=5, content=3 Build [Term: queryMatch]: hierarchy, files, relationships, doc excerpts, AI suggestions Sort by score, output JSON Output modes: concise (default, ~5-10k tokens) or --verbose (full context, ~25k tokens)
